results.title: Bubbling spring = Quan shi ding dong
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Film Studios, Chen Rongxuan and Xiaohua Shi
results.brief_description:
The film revolves around the children of a newly forged community. When she was a little girl, Granny Tao used a warm heart to bridge the divide between her and her stepmother, which gave her the strength to help others learn to care for those around them. It’s not long, however, before the naughty child Xiao Hou (lit. “Little Monkey”) starts playing around on the dangerous high wall, injuring Bingbing’s arm, knocking over ink bottles and ruining the music student Xueli’s university graduation assignment.
Xueli is angry that her Granny Tao opened her home to these children and leaves home. Granny Tao becomes so distressed by these events that she falls ill, and the children go to find help. When Xueli is advised by her friends to return home to help her ailing grandma, she is stunned to find the previously raucous children diligently caring for the old woman. Xueli is moved by this to find inspiration for a graduation piece even better than her first, which she names “Spring Water Ding-Dong”.

Cultural History of the Film:
The film is a commentary on the social changes taking place within China at the time, as well as emphasising the importance of the happiness and education of a community’s children. After moving into one of the government’s newly constructed residential buildings, people from many different walks of life are faced with the joys and trials of forging a new community. China today is filled with such communities, which sprang up as a result of these government-constructed residential buildings, and the film provides a valuable glimpse into how life was at the beginning of this significant development, and how the struggles of living in such communities shaped the lives of those children, who are now the parents of today.
(2 stars - James Donald; December 15, 2010)

results.title: Bubbling over
results.brief_description: Short comedy film with singer Ethel Waters playing the part of a wife whose husband’s lazy live-in relatives make life difficult. Featuring Hamtree Harrington, the Southernaires Quartet, William Edmondson and Frank L. Wilson.

results.title: Bubbles Co-op: secondary fiction (Episode 3)
results.brief_description: This films presents two fiction films from the University of Melbourne “Bubbles Co-op” Film Festival. ine is in black and white and is technically poor; the second is shorter in length and is in colour. Suitable for Upper Primary-Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Bubbles Co-op: secondary animation (Episode 1)
results.brief_description: This film presents secondary school students’ animated films which were screened at the University of Melbourne “Bubbles Co-op” Film Festival. Indicates the range and depth of their concerns, imagination and considerable talents. A stimulating, amusing and refreshing compilation. Suitable for Upper Primary-Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Bubbles Co-op. Part 1: primary films
results.brief_description: A compilation of primary school children’s films which were screened at Melbourne University “Bubbles Co-op” Film Festival. Films shown include a science fiction drama, a social documentary and several animated films. Suitable for Upper Primary-Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Bsss
results.brief_description: A fly meets an elephant…by the book! A fly buzzes around a room landing upon a book with pictures of an elephant inside. The fly appears to investigate the drawing. A human squashes the fly into the book. Fly and elephant are united. (Screened at MISAF, October 2000.)

results.title: Bryce - Zion - Grand Canyon
results.brief_description: A travelogue showing Bryce Canyon National Park in Southern Utah, Zion National Park (one mile away from Bryce Canyon) where the road pases through the mountain and the tunnel has “windows” cut through its sides which give amazing views of the canyon valley through to Pine Canyon. And finally, the Grand Canyon in Arizona where tourists on horse-back are taken into the canyon with guides. Shows the magnificent views of the canyon as seen from the buses touring along the roads. Edited by Eugene Castle.

results.title: Brute force and finesse: new ways of shaping and forming materials
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Max Morgan-Witts
results.brief_description: Recent advances in manufacturing techniques, including electron beam welding, explosive forming, spark machining, hydrostatic extrusion, and cold forming are demonstrated in this film.

results.title: Brush with royalty
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and David Poynter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A group of artists from Broken Hill prepare for an exhibition of their work in London. Artists include Pro Hart and Jack Absalom, and all use the countryside around Broken Hill as their source of inspiration. This film is recommended for students in Years 9-12.
